name: Whispering Hollow
description:
The trees lean in close, their skeletal branches tangled overhead.
 A breeze stirs the dry leaves, making them rustle like hushed voices sharing secrets.

name: The Crooked Path
description:
The trail twists unnaturally, as if avoiding something unseen.
 The gnarled roots claw at the dirt, waiting for careless feet to stumble.

name: The Hollow Glade
description:
The trees thin out into a small clearing, but the silence here is heavy.
 No birds, no insects—only the distant creak of unseen boughs shifting.

name: Veil of Fog
description:
A thin mist clings to the undergrowth, curling around your ankles like searching fingers. 
 It never quite rises above your knees, as if afraid to go higher.

name: Echoing Thicket
description:
Every step you take is answered by another, fainter footfall.
 The underbrush is dense, the shadows long—perhaps the sound is only the forest mocking you.

name: The Watching Wood
description:
Knotholes in the trees gape like empty eyes, some wide, others squinting as if scrutinizing your every move.
 It’s just natural erosion... probably.

name: Spider’s Passage
description:
Silver threads dangle from low branches, swaying slightly despite the still air.
 You don’t see any spiders, but the strands stretch far into the trees.

name: The Sunken Trail
description:
The ground dips lower here, flanked by steep ridges of roots and moss.
 The deeper you walk, the less the wind reaches you. The world feels further away.

name: Bonewhite Grove
description:
The bark of the trees here is pale and peeling, their branches stark against the sky like brittle ribs.
 A few fallen logs are hollowed out, bleached by time.

name: The Breathing Glade
description:
The wind moves strangely here, exhaling in long, steady sighs.
 The leaves ripple as if something beneath them is stirring, but nothing ever emerges.

name: The Murmuring Pines
description:
The wind moves through the tall trees in such a way that it almost sounds like voices.
 The more you listen, the harder it is to convince yourself they aren’t words.

name: The Rootweb
description:
The forest floor is a tangled maze of exposed roots, twisting and weaving 
as if the trees are trying to hold something beneath the soil.

name: Lantern Hollow
description:
Small patches of luminescent fungi cling to rotting logs and damp stones, casting a sickly green glow. 
They pulse gently, as though breathing.

name: The Croaking Fen
description:
A shallow mist pools over the ground, damp and cloying.
 Frogs call from the darkness, their voices deep and hollow, echoing longer than they should.

name: The Hollow Trunk
description:
A massive fallen tree stretches across the path, its insides rotted away into a gaping tunnel.
 The air inside is damp and strangely still, as if waiting.

name: Silent Crossing
description:
A narrow bridge of stone spans a small ravine.
 The moment you step onto it, the forest sounds fade away entirely. Only when you reach the other side do they return.

name: The Scorched Grove
description:
A handful of trees stand blackened and dead, charred as though by an old fire.
 Yet the undergrowth around them is untouched, thriving as if the flames never spread.

name: The Endless Trunk
description:
A massive tree stands before you, its bark rough and furrowed.
 You step around it, then again, and again. Have you really moved at all?

name: The Twisting Boughs
description:
The branches overhead curl and knot together, 
 forming intricate patterns in the air.

 Some look like shapes
—figures, faces—
but it’s just coincidence.

name: The Listening Grove
description:
You pause for a moment, and the forest goes silent with you.
 No birds, no insects, just waiting, as if something unseen is listening too.
